supplements.name: Caffeine
supplements.description: Caffeine is the world's most widely consumed psychoactive substance and the most-studied nootropic. It's a natural stimulant found in coffee, tea, and many supplements that enhances alertness, focus, and physical performance.
supplements.mechanism: Adenosine A1 and A2A receptor antagonist; blocks adenosine-induced drowsiness, increases catecholamine release (dopamine, norepinephrine, epinephrine). Inhibits phosphodiesterase.

dosage.notes: Tolerance develops with regular use. Cycle off periodically for maximum effect.

drugInteractions: CYP1A2 substrate - metabolized slower with some antibiotics
May reduce effectiveness of some sedatives

scientificEvidence.summary: Caffeine improves endurance, strength, and power output in numerous studies.
Well-documented improvements in attention, reaction time, and memory.

supplements.metaTitle: Caffeine - Benefits, Dosage, Side Effects & Where to Buy
supplements.metaDescription: Complete guide to caffeine supplements: benefits for energy and performance, optimal dosage, side effects, and the best quality products to buy.

supplements.name: L-Theanine
supplements.description: L-Theanine is an amino acid found naturally in tea leaves that promotes relaxation without sedation. It's renowned for its synergy with caffeine, providing calm focus.
benefits: Enhanced focus when paired with caffeine
supplements.mechanism: Increases alpha brain wave activity (8-12 Hz), modulates glutamate/GABA neurotransmission, crosses blood-brain barrier efficiently.

dosage.timing: Any time; 30 min before stressful events
dosage.notes: Synergistic with caffeine (1:2 ratio caffeine:theanine recommended).

sideEffects: Mild headache at very high doses

scientificEvidence.summary: Multiple studies show L-theanine reduces stress markers and promotes relaxation.
sources: Asia Pacific Journal of Clinical Nutrition

supplements.metaDescription: Complete guide to L-Theanine: benefits for relaxation and focus, optimal dosage, caffeine synergy, and the best quality products to buy.

supplements.name: Creatine Monohydrate
supplements.description: Creatine monohydrate is the most researched and effective sports supplement for increasing strength, power, and muscle mass. It also has cognitive benefits.
supplements.mechanism: Increases phosphocreatine in muscle cells, improving ATP regeneration during intense exercise. Increases myonuclei in muscle fibers.

dosage.timing: Any time daily; consistency matters more than timing
dosage.notes: Loading phase optional: 20g/day for 5-7 days, then 3-5g maintenance.

scientificEvidence.summary: Most researched supplement with overwhelming evidence for performance benefits.
sources: Journal of the International Society of Sports Nutrition

supplements.metaTitle: Creatine Monohydrate - Benefits, Dosage & Best Products
supplements.metaDescription: Complete guide to Creatine Monohydrate: proven benefits for strength and muscle, optimal dosage protocol, and the best quality products to buy.

supplements.name: Beta-Alanine
supplements.description: Beta-alanine is an amino acid that increases muscle carnosine levels, buffering lactic acid during high-intensity exercise to improve endurance.
supplements.mechanism: Precursor to carnosine, which buffers hydrogen ions (lactic acid) in muscle. Takes 2-4 weeks of daily use to build tissue levels.

dosage.timing: Split doses throughout day to reduce tingling; or take with meals
dosage.notes: Tingling (paresthesia) is harmless. Takes 2-4 weeks to saturate muscles.

sideEffects: Rare: nausea at high single doses

scientificEvidence.summary: Consistent evidence for improved performance in 1-4 minute duration activities.

supplements.metaDescription: Complete guide to Beta-Alanine: benefits for endurance, tingling explained, optimal dosage, and the best quality products to buy.

supplements.name: Citrulline Malate
supplements.description: Citrulline malate is an amino acid compound that enhances nitric oxide production for improved blood flow, muscle pumps, and endurance.
supplements.mechanism: Converted to arginine then to nitric oxide, improving vasodilation and blood flow. Malate supports ATP regeneration via the Krebs cycle.

dosage.notes: 2:1 citrulline to malate ratio is standard. Pure L-citrulline needs lower doses.

scientificEvidence.summary: Good evidence for improved endurance and reduced fatigue during resistance training.

supplements.metaTitle: Citrulline Malate - Benefits, Dosage & Best Products
supplements.metaDescription: Complete guide to Citrulline Malate: benefits for pumps and endurance, optimal dosage, and the best quality products to buy.

supplements.name: Ashwagandha
supplements.description: Ashwagandha is an adaptogenic herb used for thousands of years in Ayurveda. It helps the body manage stress, reduces cortisol, and may improve sleep quality.
supplements.mechanism: Withanolides modulate GABA receptors and stress hormone pathways. Acts as an adaptogen, helping the body resist stressors.

dosage.timing: Morning or evening; consistent daily use
dosage.notes: Use standardized extracts (KSM-66 or Sensoril). Takes 2-4 weeks for full effects.

scientificEvidence.summary: Multiple RCTs show significant reductions in cortisol and perceived stress.

supplements.metaDescription: Complete guide to Ashwagandha: benefits for stress and cortisol, KSM-66 vs Sensoril, optimal dosage, and the best quality products to buy.

supplements.name: Rhodiola Rosea
supplements.description: Rhodiola rosea is an adaptogenic herb that helps combat fatigue, improve mood, and enhance work capacity under stress.
supplements.mechanism: Rosavins and salidroside modulate monoamine neurotransmitters (serotonin, dopamine, norepinephrine). Increases cellular energy production.

dosage.timing: Morning on empty stomach; avoid late day (may affect sleep)
dosage.notes: Use extract standardized to 3% rosavins, 1% salidroside.

scientificEvidence.summary: Good evidence for improved mental performance under stress and fatigue.

supplements.metaTitle: Rhodiola Rosea - Benefits, Dosage & Best Products
supplements.metaDescription: Complete guide to Rhodiola Rosea: benefits for fatigue and mood, optimal dosage, standardization, and the best quality products to buy.

supplements.name: Magnesium Glycinate
supplements.description: Magnesium glycinate is a highly bioavailable form of magnesium chelated with glycine. It's excellent for sleep, relaxation, and muscle recovery with minimal GI side effects.
supplements.mechanism: Magnesium activates GABA receptors and is required for 300+ enzymatic reactions. Glycine provides additional calming effects.

dosage.notes: Dosage refers to elemental magnesium. Check supplement label for actual content.

drugInteractions: May reduce absorption of some antibiotics and bisphosphonates

scientificEvidence.summary: Good evidence for sleep improvements, especially in those with deficiency.

supplements.metaTitle: Magnesium Glycinate - Benefits, Dosage & Best Products
supplements.metaDescription: Complete guide to Magnesium Glycinate: benefits for sleep and relaxation, why glycinate is best, optimal dosage, and the best products to buy.

supplements.name: Lion's Mane Mushroom
supplements.description: Lion's Mane is a medicinal mushroom that supports cognitive function by stimulating nerve growth factor (NGF) production. It may help with memory, focus, and neuroprotection.
supplements.mechanism: Hericenones and erinacines stimulate NGF and BDNF production, supporting neuroplasticity, nerve regeneration, and myelin health.

dosage.notes: Use fruiting body extracts for best bioavailability. Effects take 4-8 weeks.

scientificEvidence.summary: Promising evidence for cognitive benefits, especially in older adults.

supplements.metaTitle: Lion's Mane Mushroom - Benefits, Dosage & Best Products
supplements.metaDescription: Complete guide to Lion's Mane: cognitive benefits, NGF support, optimal dosage, fruiting body vs mycelium, and the best quality products to buy.

supplements.name: Alpha-GPC
supplements.description: Alpha-GPC is a highly bioavailable choline source that crosses the blood-brain barrier efficiently, supporting acetylcholine production for memory and focus.
supplements.mechanism: Directly supplies choline for acetylcholine synthesis. Crosses the blood-brain barrier efficiently, unlike other choline sources.

dosage.timing: 30-60 minutes before cognitive tasks or workouts
dosage.notes: Often stacked with other nootropics. May enhance growth hormone when taken pre-workout.

drugInteractions: May enhance effects of cholinergic drugs

scientificEvidence.summary: Evidence supports cognitive benefits, particularly in older adults with decline.

supplements.metaDescription: Complete guide to Alpha-GPC: cognitive benefits, choline for brain health, optimal dosage, and the best quality products to buy.
